EXTRACTED VALUE: Boogie Bunnies isn't so much bad as it is unimaginative, derivative, and just plain boring.
The game design is pretty cool for a next-gen console, but the meat and potatoes of a real exciting street racer got checked at the door.
Sneak King gets stale ridiculously fast. At least the achievements are easy.
Innovative, pretty, interesting at first glance... but ultimately: boring, boring, boring. [Oct 2007, p.96]
It's just run-of-the-mill game design. Bar the occasionally impressive combat, Beowulf doesn't have enough to make it stand out.
Beyond the control issues, Alien Resurrection is gruelingly hard.
The AI is so completely non-existent that the old "whack one button and win" strategy still works wonders. [Nov 2001, p.220]
If you like to be tortured, you could just go to the store right now and pick up the game; you'll be very satisfied.
How could Reflections screw this up so bad? Driver 2 is a pale reflection (har har) of the original.
Spectral Force 3 is a throwback to older days from the genre, but feels a bit too antiquated and uninteresting to be recommendable.
Despite its flaws, many of which are correctable with a patch, it does an admirable job of sharpening your mind in an entertaining fashion.
Despite the hype, Legend of Dragoon is a soulless creature, a subpar game held aloft by deceptive marketing. Don't trust it.
The six mini-games are fun to play... for about 30 minutes each.
